comments:
Build ID: M20070212-1330

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Download eclipse-SDK-3.2.2-linux-gtk-x86_64.tar.gz and eclipse-SDK-3.2.1-linux-gtk-x86_64.tar.gz and installed both.
2.Using Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 1.5.0_08-b03, mixed mode) running eclipse so it creates a new workspace the later version fails to start up.
3.I have been using the earlier version for months and has been working fine.  I downloaded fresh copies of both to reduce the number of possible components.


More information:
During startup (while the splash screen is showing I get the following error in a dialog:- 

JVM terminated. Exit code=127
/usr/bin/java
-Xms40m
-Xmx256m
-jar /home/rcm/tmp/eclipse-3.2.2/./startup.jar
-os linux
-ws gtk
-arch x86_64
-launcher /home/rcm/tmp/eclipse-3.2.2/./eclipse
-name Eclipse
-showsplash 600
-exitdata 538017
-data ../workspace
-vm /usr/bin/java
-vmargs
-Xms40m
-Xmx256m
-jar /home/rcm/tmp/eclipse-3.2.2/./startup.jar

Correction.  This fails when using other JDK, sepecifically:
     Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_06-b05)
BEA JRockit(R) (build R26.4.0-63-63688-1.5.0_06-20060626-2259-linux-x86_64, )

    Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build Blackdown-1.4.2-03)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build Blackdown-1.4.2-03, mixed mode)

    Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0-b105)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 1.6.0-b105, mixed mode)

It does NOT fail with Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 1.5.0_08-b03, mixed mode), but the internal browser gives the following error:

No more handles (java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no swt-mozilla-gtk-3236 in java.library.path)

In my existing version of Eclipse (the one that I have been using all along with a number of plug-ins, and recently updated to 3.2.2 when I started getting problems) the crash occurs when I try to open up the internal browser.  I get the same error:-
